Call your dr that is too low.

It's amazing that pregnancy books talk about hypertension and preeclampsia, but don't talk about low blood pressure (normal is 120/80).  Your diastolic number (the lower number) is quite scary.  You need to have your thyroid checked, a septicimia test, and a test to see if you've developed gestational diabetes.  If those check out okay, you need to drink more fluids, take iron, B-12 and folate supplements along with a better nutrition overall.  Personally, my iron levels were very low causing low blood pressure.  I've been taking iron supplements for the last 6 or so weeks.  My energy came back within a few days of starting the supplement.

Low blood pressure is actually very common while pregnant for half a variety of reasons. What is your normal? There are a few ways to remedy it if you can't immediately get in. You need to drink LOTS of water, and elevate your feet. This can be done by laying on the floor with your feet up, pillows on a couch, bed, etc etc. Its also important to speak to your doctor about. It's not life or death, but is important to discuss. If it bottoms out you risk syncope and just feeling miserable and being pregnant its possible harm could be done to the baby if you fainted. If it doesn't get better, DO NOT drive or move too much. Call family or EMS personal.
